metadata.title: CVE-2016-3616 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The cjpeg utility in libjpeg allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) or executearbitrary code via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3
libturbojpeg - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-0ubuntu3').
libjpeg9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
